item.title: Griffiti on road at 4 locations on Bushcombe Lane, 27th July
item.description:

item.title: Tree causing damage to wall, 27th July
item.description:
The tree outside 142 Brooklyn road Cheltenham.Has caused our front brick wall to split overnight, and is also pushing up the pavement .The wall is double bricked with 28 inches x 18 inches deep footings .The tree has also got lots of dead branches on it which are also a concern .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Brooklyn Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: 2 temporary excavation covers - 5yrs here now, 27th July
item.description:
There are two plastic covers on excavations which have been like this for over 5 years - I have email trail to prove this. They’re slowly starting to disintegrate due to age. Please can the holes be filled in and the verge restored?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Footpaths ASH 8 & ASH 9 impassable, 27th July
item.description:
Junction of footpaths and for some distance leading to that junction. I tried to use the PROW from Hatherley Cricket Club to pick up the footpath which should run from Leckhampton Lane to Shurdington Rd this morning. When I came near to the 'T' junction of these paths it was impossible to find a way through. I retraced my steps to the Cricket club and came along the A46 to try and find the path from the Shurdington Rd end. Again I was thwarted by vegetation. This is the second time this year I have reported the state of these paths and I see that at least one other person has reported it. This path is an important route for people wishing to avoid the busy A46 and it is a legal right of way. I would appreciate an early site visit from your representatives and proper reinstatement of these footpaths. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown, abandoned public grass space, 27th July
item.description:
The large grass area area in the middle of Beverley Gardens has been abandoned since Tewkesbury Borough Council handed back grass cutting to GCC Highways in 2024. The area is overgrown, in places over 1m high. Visibility on these bends is already a problem due to high hedges and parked cars. Seeing oncoming traffic as you move onto off off your drive is increasingly hazardous due to the current neglect. The grass cannot be allowed to grown unchecked for ever - which appears to be TBC and GCC's intent. Residents plan to attack the area with scythes - have we really come to this?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Gardens, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The large public grass area at Byfield Close has not been cut since Tewkesbury Borough Council handed grass cutting responsibility back to Gloucestershire County Council Highways in 2024. The area is overgrown, apparently abandoned by both TBC and GCC and in urgent need of cutting., 27th July
item.description:
Byfield Close - you can't miss the jungle if you visit. It is between 2,3,5,8 and 11 Byfield Close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Byfield Close, Tewkesbury
